title: Experience-Based Learning Design to Overcome Barriers in Disclosing Abuse Experiences

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Psychology-integrated education for undergraduate science students. Limited digital resource access via smartphones. Emphasis on practical learning activities tailored to working professionals.

learning_goals: Learners can explain three psychological and social barriers that occur during the disclosure process of abuse experiences.
Learners can propose two scientific approaches to overcome barriers by analyzing real-world cases.
Learners can present and receive evaluations on support system-building strategies through experience-based role-playing in teams.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
